I just barely tolerate the whole breast cancer awareness thing. I know it's necessary, but still. This reminds me. Does anyone else notice other womens clevage A LOT more than you did before or is it just me?
Posts.Title: Hiding over here while the rocks fly my way... Running_Violet kim40

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2011 02:03AM carpediemocc wrote: Thank you all for the advice.I am up now unable to sleep. Reality hitting home. I think the most important thing for me right now is tostay in the positive. I'll try and do what I can until I am incapacitated. Have a serious talk with my son about me not always being around and how he needs to make his own way. That's all I can think of now to do.
Posts.Title: Brain mets diagnosis carpediemocc Lena

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2011 08:26AM carpediemocc wrote: No Military Affiliation. Occ Stands for Orange county choppers lol. I finished with my third whole brain radiation Session this morning Drove myself there did okay. Still waiting to hear back from the american cancer society volunteer For transportation. They are not being very helpful. I feel okay Just a teeny bit cloudy in the brain Thinking maybe this won't be so bad.
Posts.Title: Brain mets diagnosis carpediemocc Lena

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2008 10:17AM carpediemocc wrote: Goldie - I'm one of the ones whose hair just thinned out. I just had my second big (3 drugs) chemo a week ago Friday. I used to have GOBS of rich full thick hair. Everytime I would brush it the brush seemed to be full of hair, but friends said it didn't look any different. I got tired of worrying about how or when it would all just come out so I shaved my head. If I had to do it all over I would have just cut my hair really short instead. I broke out all over my head and wearing a wig is itchy and almost unbearable at this point and the little fuzz of hiar i have left actually hurts and is pokey. I'm thinking abouting waxing my head now LOL!
Posts.Title: Has anyone started a forum for Chemo in Dec 2008? horsercn Texas357

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2009 12:14PM carpediemocc wrote: I'm going in on the 29th. Mt birthday is the 30th! I'll be having a modified radical mastectomy. I have already completed my neo adjuvant chemo, so thank you Jesus for seeing me through that. I am also nervous and have had moments where I was just so sure I wasn't going to survive this, certain I had cancer coursing all through my body, but I am fine. I have to be careful not to let my thoughts get away from me. It's really easy to feel sorry for yourself when you have cancer ;) My Onc doc put me on Effexor and it has helped quite a bit with the anxiety although at times I feel I culd use something a little stronger. I'm the biggest of wimps so if I can do it you can too!!
